title: How long can someone live with 90% arterial blockage? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on cardiac demands, where the artery is, and other co-morbid disorders. It also depends on treatment plans and patient compliance. Long Term & Physiological Effects of Coronary Artery Disease Coronary disease leads to total blockage in 10% of patients Valvular problems, even viral infections can decrease the efficiency of this pump greatly. A 90% occlusion of one or more arteries is a concern but doesn’t necessarily result in morbidity. A urinary tract infection or pneumonia can come along and cause death in any individual suffering from brain tumors, cardiac, or other scary conditions.

My credential for this answer is many years experience as an Interventional Cardiovascular Physician and current Cath Lab Director, NYPQ Hospital. If you have or a family member has a 90% arterial blockage then you get together with a physician and come up with an approriate plan of treatment. A well executed treatment plan is the best way to handle any form of artery disease. Stop thinking about how long life will last and start thinking about how to live with problem you have by taking care of it with the assistance of/from your physicians.
